item.title: Lindsay add a quote by William Faulkner
item.description: "My mother is a fish." -- William Faulkner

item.title: Lindsay add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "It's a beautiful thing, the destruction of words." -- George Orwell

item.title: Lindsay add a quote by Harper Lee
item.description: "I wanted you to see what real courage is, instead of getting the idea that courage is a man with a gun in his hand. It's when you know you're licked before you begin, but you begin anyway and see it through no matter what. - Atticus Finch" -- Harper Lee

item.title: Lindsay add a quote by Fyodor Dostoyevsky
item.description: "Drowning men, it is said, cling to wisps of straw." -- Fyodor Dostoyevsky

item.title: Lindsay add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "All animals are equal, but some animals are more equal than others." -- George Orwell

item.title: Lindsay add a quote by Charles Schultz
item.description: "<b>I</b> love mankind ... it's <b>people</b> I can't stand!!" -- Charles Schultz

item.title: Lindsay add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "Courage is what it takes to stand up and speak; courage is also what it takes to sit down and listen." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Lindsay add a quote by Thomas Jefferson
item.description: "On matters of style, swim with the current, on matters of principle, stand like a rock." -- Thomas Jefferson

item.title: Lindsay add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "The ultimate measure of a man is not where he stands in moments of comfort and convenience, but where he stands at times of challenge and controversy." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Lindsay add a quote by Garrison Keillor
item.description: "Cats are intended to teach us that not everything in nature has a purpose." -- Garrison Keillor
